bug.short_desc: setup alternatives for wxrc and wx-config

long_desc.thetext: Alright so obviously the conflicting file in wxrc for wxgtk and wxgtk3 is a file, so I wish to collaborate and agree to use something like alternatives for this file. Please let me know of this is an issue because I keep getting requests to resolve this. Thanks

Both wxrc and wx-config for wxGTK3 are placed in /usr/libexec/wxGTK3/ If you wish to do the same, alternatives and symlinks could be setup fairly easily. I don't see this as a blocking issue to any builds right now, so it's more of a "nice to have" from what I see.

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 22 development cycle. Changing version to '22'. More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_Program_Management/HouseKeeping/Fedora22
Assuming this as won't fix, reopen if things change.
Why was this closed as won't fix?
The wxGTK maintainer seemed to have no interest within the 2 year span it was open. I closed it as won't fix, as I would need his cooperation to resolve this. If things change, this can be reopened.
If you can, please take over the wxGTK maintanership, just ask in pkgdb. -ENOTIME :-(
Ok sounds good, I'll put the request in pkgdb. Thanks!
Did someone take over the wxGTK maintanership?
I took over maintainership. Sorry for the delay. Unfortunately, I had a bit of a busy month and a half. I should be able to get this fixed in rawhide no later than the second week of July.
No problem! Thanks for doing this :)

Fedora 22 changed to end-of-life (EOL) status on 2016-07-19. Fedora 22 is no longer maintained, which means that it will not receive any further security or bug fix updates. As a result we are closing this bug. If you can reproduce this bug against a currently maintained version of Fedora please feel free to reopen this bug against that version. If you are unable to reopen this bug, please file a new report against the current release. If you experience problems, please add a comment to this bug. Thank you for reporting this bug and we are sorry it could not be fixed.
New bug report for Fedora 24: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1357872
*** Bug 1357872 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 25 development cycle. Changing version to '25'.
Fixed in rawhide, please let me know if anyone has any issues. I will backport to Fedora/EPEL if requested, but I would prefer not to as this is dependant on also backporting the fix from wxGTK.
